name: Art For Three
description:
(i will upload a mac build soonish)

Three players create artwork together under time pressure. Art For Three was designed to be exhibited at events, but now you can play it from the comfort of your own home!

How to play:

Plug in three controllers (they should *just work*)
-or-
WSAD to move, Q/E for A/B
IJKL to move, U/O for A/B
ARROWS to move, ENTER/SHIFT for A/B

...

Run 'octosew.exe' or 'octosew.app'
This name comes from the original inspiration for the game:
Tracing, cutting, and sewing together octopus plushies.
(You can still find the last few at www.wowowgifty.com)

...

Press '0' to start or to extend the timer, 1 minute at a time.
Originally this game was coin-operated...
and this was the debug button to test it out.

Credits:

Design, development, bad sprites by droqen
Desk sprites by (redacted)
Artworks (featured prominently in third image on the right) made by lots of people

First exhibited at Bit Bazaar a few years ago! I forget how many.

How to find your art:

Open up the _Data folder or right click on the .app (once I've uploaded it) and click 'Show Package Contents' and wander around blindly until you find the Streaming Assets folder. All uploaded art is in there!

Note that you have to upload art first by bringing it to the bottom-left hand corner. This game is really meant to be exhibited and not downloaded but I'm sure you can figure it out
